title: New research confirms: you need to give more feedback (even if you don’t want to)
content:
Imagine you’re talking to someone and they have a big green piece of something they ate for lunch in their teeth. Do you tell them? Whether you do might depend on who they are (you might be more likely to tell your best friend than a work colleague) and perhaps your own personality too. There’s no doubt many of us avoid giving feedback. It can feel awkward to tell somebody they have something in their teeth, or elsewhere. description: People tend not to provide constructive feedback – even when it would help the other person. But new research shows people want to hear it.
